To prove that œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 2 and 3 rules it suffices to prove

{lx,hx}‚äÜ‚Å¢int‚Å°(Dz/Dy)¬†and¬†{ly,hy}‚äÜ‚Å¢int‚Å°(Dz/Dx).{lx,hx}‚äÜ‚Å¢int‚Å°(Dz/Dy)¬†and¬†{ly,hy}‚äÜ‚Å¢int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)\mbox{$\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})$ and $\mbox{$\{{l_{y},h_{y}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})$}.{lx,hx} ‚äÜ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and {ly,hy} ‚äÜ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (7)

We need to distinguish a number of cases. The case analysis depends on the position of 0 w.r.t.¬†each of the intervals Dxsubscriptùê∑ùë•D_{x}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Dysubscriptùê∑ùë¶D_{y}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This leads to 9 cases, which by symmetry between xùë•xitalic_x and yùë¶yitalic_y can be reduced to 6 cases. We present here the proofs for representative 3 cases.

Case 1. lx‚â•0,ly‚â•0formulae-sequencesubscriptùëôùë•0subscriptùëôùë¶0l_{x}\geq 0,\ l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0 , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0.

By the bounds consistency of xùë•xitalic_x for some b‚àà[ly,hy]ùëèsubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have lx‚ãÖb‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèsubscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then b‚â§hyùëèsubscript‚Ñéùë¶b\leq h_{y}italic_b ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and lx‚â•0subscriptùëôùë•0l_{x}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0, so lx‚ãÖb‚â§lx‚ãÖhy‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëè‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{x}\cdot b\leq l_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also lz‚â§lx‚ãÖbsubscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèl_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b, so

lz‚â§lx‚ãÖhy.subscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot h_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yùë¶yitalic_y for some a‚àà[lx,hx]ùëésubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have a‚ãÖhy‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖùëésubscript‚Ñéùë¶subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßa\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lx‚â§asubscriptùëôùë•ùëél_{x}\leq aitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a and hy‚â•0subscript‚Ñéùë¶0h_{y}\geq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0, so lx‚ãÖhy‚â§a‚ãÖhy‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶‚ãÖùëésubscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq a\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also a‚ãÖhy‚â§hz‚ãÖùëésubscript‚Ñéùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßa\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lx‚ãÖhy‚â§hz.‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So lx‚ãÖhy‚àà[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

lx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†hy‚ààDz/Dx.lx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†hy‚ààDz/Dx\mbox{$l_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

By a symmetric argument

hx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†ly‚ààDz/Dx.hx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†ly‚ààDz/Dx\mbox{$h_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $l_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Case 2. lx‚â•0,hy‚â§0formulae-sequencesubscriptùëôùë•0subscript‚Ñéùë¶0l_{x}\geq 0,\ h_{y}\leq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0 , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ 0.

By the bounds consistency of xùë•xitalic_x for some b‚àà[ly,hy]ùëèsubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have hx‚ãÖb‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•ùëèsubscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßh_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then b‚â§hyùëèsubscript‚Ñéùë¶b\leq h_{y}italic_b ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hx‚â•0subscript‚Ñéùë•0h_{x}\geq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0, so hx‚ãÖb‚â§hx‚ãÖhy‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•ùëè‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶h_{x}\cdot b\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also lz‚â§hx‚ãÖbsubscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•ùëèl_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b, so

lz‚â§hx‚ãÖhy.subscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yùë¶yitalic_y for some a‚àà[lx,hx]ùëésubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have a‚ãÖhy‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖùëésubscript‚Ñéùë¶subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßa\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then a‚â§hxùëésubscript‚Ñéùë•a\leq h_{x}italic_a ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hy‚â§0subscript‚Ñéùë¶0h_{y}\leq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ 0, so a‚ãÖhy‚â•hx‚ãÖhy‚ãÖùëésubscript‚Ñéùë¶‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶a\cdot h_{y}\geq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also hz‚â•a‚ãÖhysubscript‚Ñéùëß‚ãÖùëésubscript‚Ñéùë¶h_{z}\geq a\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

hx‚ãÖhy‚â§hz.‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßh_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So hx‚ãÖhy‚àà[lz..hz]h_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

hx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†hy‚ààDz/Dx.hx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†hy‚ààDz/Dx\mbox{$h_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Further, by the bounds consistency of xùë•xitalic_x for some b‚àà[ly,hy]ùëèsubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have lx‚ãÖb‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèsubscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then ly‚â§bsubscriptùëôùë¶ùëèl_{y}\leq bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_b and lx‚â•0subscriptùëôùë•0l_{x}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0, so lx‚ãÖly‚â§lx‚ãÖb‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèl_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq l_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b. Also lx‚ãÖb‚â§hz‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèsubscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot b\leq h_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lx‚ãÖly‚â§hz.‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yùë¶yitalic_y for some a‚àà[lx,hx]ùëésubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have a‚ãÖly‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßa\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lx‚â§asubscriptùëôùë•ùëél_{x}\leq aitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a and ly<0subscriptùëôùë¶0l_{y}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so lx‚ãÖly‚â•a‚ãÖly‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\geq a\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also a‚ãÖly‚â•lz‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶subscriptùëôùëßa\cdot l_{y}\geq l_{z}italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lz‚â§lx‚ãÖly.subscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot l_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So lx‚ãÖly‚àà[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

lx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†ly‚ààDz/Dx.lx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†ly‚ààDz/Dx\mbox{$l_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $l_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Case 3. lx<0<hx,ly‚â•0formulae-sequencesubscriptùëôùë•0subscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùë¶0l_{x}<0<h_{x},\ l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 < italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0.

The proof for this case is somewhat more elaborate. By the bounds consistency of xùë•xitalic_x for some b‚àà[ly,hy]ùëèsubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have lx‚ãÖb‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèsubscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then ly‚â§bsubscriptùëôùë¶ùëèl_{y}\leq bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_b and lx<0subscriptùëôùë•0l_{x}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so lx‚ãÖly‚â•lx‚ãÖb‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèl_{x}\cdot l_{y}\geq l_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b. But also lx‚ãÖb‚â•lz‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•ùëèsubscriptùëôùëßl_{x}\cdot b\geq l_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚â• italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lz‚â§lx‚ãÖly.subscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot l_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yùë¶yitalic_y for some a‚àà[lx,hx]ùëésubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have a‚ãÖly‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßa\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lx‚â§asubscriptùëôùë•ùëél_{x}\leq aitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a and ly‚â•0subscriptùëôùë¶0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0, so lx‚ãÖly‚â§a‚ãÖly‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq a\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. But also a‚ãÖly‚â§hz‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßa\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lx‚ãÖly‚â§hz.‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So lx‚ãÖly‚àà[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

lx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†ly‚ààDz/Dx.lx‚ààDz/Dy¬†and¬†ly‚ààDz/Dx\mbox{$l_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $l_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Further, by the bounds consistency of xùë•xitalic_x for some b‚àà[ly,hy]ùëèsubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have hx‚ãÖb‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•ùëèsubscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßh_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then ly‚â§bsubscriptùëôùë¶ùëèl_{y}\leq bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_b and hx>0subscript‚Ñéùë•0h_{x}>0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, so hx‚ãÖly‚â§hx‚ãÖb‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùë¶‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•ùëèh_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{x}\cdot bitalic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b. But also hx‚ãÖb‚â§hz‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•ùëèsubscript‚Ñéùëßh_{x}\cdot b\leq h_{z}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

hx‚ãÖly‚â§hz.‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßh_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, we already noted that by the bounds consistency of yùë¶yitalic_y for some a‚àà[lx,hx]ùëésubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have a‚ãÖly‚àà[lz,hz]‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßa\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then a‚â§hxùëésubscript‚Ñéùë•a\leq h_{x}italic_a ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ly‚â•0subscriptùëôùë¶0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0, so a‚ãÖly‚â§hx‚ãÖly‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùë¶a\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{x}\cdot l_{y}italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. But also lz‚â§a‚ãÖlysubscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖùëésubscriptùëôùë¶l_{z}\leq a\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lz‚â§hx‚ãÖly.subscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùë¶l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot l_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So hx‚ãÖly‚àà[lz..hz]h_{x}\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

hx‚ààDz/Dy.subscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\mbox{$h_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

It remains to prove that hy‚ààDz/Dxsubscript‚Ñéùë¶subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We showed already lx‚ãÖly‚â§hz‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Moreover, lx<0subscriptùëôùë•0l_{x}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 and ly‚â§hysubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{y}\leq h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so lx‚ãÖhy‚â§lx‚ãÖly‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùë¶l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq l_{x}\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hence

lx‚ãÖhy‚â§hz.‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßl_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Also we showed already lz‚â§hx‚ãÖlysubscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùë¶l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Moreover hx>0subscript‚Ñéùë•0h_{x}>0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 and ly‚â§hysubscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{y}\leq h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so hx‚ãÖly‚â§hx‚ãÖhy‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùë¶‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶h_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hence

lz‚â§hx‚ãÖhy.subscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So if either lz‚â§lx‚ãÖhysubscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or hx‚ãÖhy‚â§hz‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßh_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then either lx‚ãÖhy‚àà[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or hx‚ãÖhy‚àà[lz..hz]h_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently hy‚ààDz/Dxsubscript‚Ñéùë¶subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

If both lx‚ãÖhy<lz‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶subscriptùëôùëßl_{x}\cdot h_{y}<l_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hz<hx‚ãÖhysubscript‚Ñéùëß‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùë¶h_{z}<h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then

[lz..hz]‚äÜ[lx..hx]‚ãÖhy.[l_{z}..h_{z}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}[l_{x}..h_{x}]\cdot h_{y}.[ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ‚äÜ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

In particular for some a‚ààDxùëésubscriptùê∑ùë•a\in D_{x}italic_a ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT we have lz=a‚ãÖhysubscriptùëôùëß‚ãÖùëésubscript‚Ñéùë¶l_{z}=a\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so hy‚ààDz/Dxsubscript‚Ñéùë¶subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, as well.

This concludes the proof for this case. ‚ñ°‚ñ°\Box‚ñ°

Proof of the Bounds consistency Theorem 9.3.

We consider each variable in turn. We begin with xùë•xitalic_x. Suppose that Dx=[lx..hx]D_{x}=[l_{x}..h_{x}]italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 2 rule, so

{lx,hx}‚äÜ‚Å¢int‚Å°(Dz/Dy).{lx,hx}‚äÜintsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y}).{lx,hx} ‚äÜ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (8)

To show the bounds consistency of xùë•xitalic_x amounts to showing

{lx,hx}‚äÜ‚Å¢Dz¬Ø‚äòDy¬Ø.‚äò{lx,hx}‚äÜ¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùëß¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}.{lx,hx} ‚äÜ over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚äò over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG . (9)

(Recall that given real intervals XùëãXitalic_X and YùëåYitalic_Y we denote by X‚äòY‚äòùëãùëåX\oslash Yitalic_X ‚äò italic_Y their division, defined in Section 3.)

Case 1. int‚Å°(Dz/Dy)=ùíµintsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶ùíµ\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})={\cal Z}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = caligraphic_Z.

This implies that 0‚ààDz‚à©Dy0subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶0\in D_{z}\cap D_{y}0 ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à© italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so by the definition of real intervals division Dz¬Ø‚äòDy¬Ø=‚ü®‚àí‚àû,‚àû‚ü©‚äò¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùëß¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}=\langle-\infty,\infty\rangleover¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚äò over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = ‚ü® - ‚àû , ‚àû ‚ü©. Hence (9) holds.

Case 2. int‚Å°(Dz/Dy)‚â†ùíµintsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶ùíµ\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})\neq{\cal Z}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â† caligraphic_Z.

So int‚Å°(Dz/Dy)intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is an integer interval, say int(Dz/Dy)=[lz‚Å¢y..hz‚Å¢y]\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})=[l_{zy}..h_{zy}]roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Two subcases arise.

Subcase 1. Dz¬Ø‚äòDy¬Ø‚äò¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùëß¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚äò over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG is a, possibly open ended, real interval.

By (8) for some b1,b2‚ààDysubscriptùëè1subscriptùëè2subscriptùê∑ùë¶b_{1},b_{2}\in D_{y}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c1,c2‚ààDzsubscriptùëê1subscriptùëê2subscriptùê∑ùëßc_{1},c_{2}\in D_{z}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT we have

lz‚Å¢y‚ãÖb1=c1,‚ãÖsubscriptùëôùëßùë¶subscriptùëè1subscriptùëê1l_{zy}\cdot b_{1}=c_{1},italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,
hz‚Å¢y‚ãÖb2=c2.‚ãÖsubscript‚Ñéùëßùë¶subscriptùëè2subscriptùëê2h_{zy}\cdot b_{2}=c_{2}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Let

b¬Ø:=min‚Å°(b1,b2),b¬Ø:=max‚Å°(b1,b2),c¬Ø:=min‚Å°(c1,c2),c¬Ø:=max‚Å°(c1,c2).formulae-sequenceassign¬Øùëèminsubscriptùëè1subscriptùëè2formulae-sequenceassign¬Øùëèmaxsubscriptùëè1subscriptùëè2formulae-sequenceassign¬Øùëêminsubscriptùëê1subscriptùëê2assign¬Øùëêmaxsubscriptùëê1subscriptùëê2\underline{b}:=\operatorname{min}(b_{1},b_{2}),\overline{b}:=\operatorname{max}(b_{1},b_{2}),\underline{c}:=\operatorname{min}(c_{1},c_{2}),\overline{c}:=\operatorname{max}(c_{1},c_{2}).under¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , under¬Ø start_ARG italic_c end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_c end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

So {lz‚Å¢y,hz‚Å¢y}‚äÜ‚Å¢[c¬Ø,c¬Ø]‚äò[b¬Ø,b¬Ø]‚äò{lz‚Å¢y,hz‚Å¢y}‚äÜ¬Øùëê¬Øùëê¬Øùëè¬Øùëè\mbox{$\{{l_{zy},h_{zy}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}[\underline{c},\overline{c}]\oslash[\underline{b},\overline{b}]{lzy,hzy} ‚äÜ [ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_c end_ARG , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_c end_ARG ] ‚äò [ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ]. Also [c¬Ø,c¬Ø]‚äò[b¬Ø,b¬Ø]‚äÜDz¬Ø‚äòDy¬Ø‚äò¬Øùëê¬Øùëê¬Øùëè¬Øùëè‚äò¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùëß¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùë¶[\underline{c},\overline{c}]\oslash[\underline{b},\overline{b}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}[ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_c end_ARG , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_c end_ARG ] ‚äò [ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ] ‚äÜ over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚äò over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Hence {lz‚Å¢y,hz‚Å¢y}‚äÜ‚Å¢Dz¬Ø‚äòDy¬Ø‚äò{lz‚Å¢y,hz‚Å¢y}‚äÜ¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùëß¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\mbox{$\{{l_{zy},h_{zy}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}{lzy,hzy} ‚äÜ over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚äò over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG and consequently, by the assumption for this subcase, [lz‚Å¢y,hz‚Å¢y]‚äÜDz¬Ø‚äòDy¬Øsubscriptùëôùëßùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßùë¶‚äò¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùëß¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùë¶[l_{zy},h_{zy}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}[ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ‚äÜ over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚äò over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. This proves (9) since by (8) {lx,hx}‚äÜ‚Å¢[lz‚Å¢y,hz‚Å¢y]{lx,hx}‚äÜsubscriptùëôùëßùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßùë¶\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}[l_{zy},h_{zy}]{lx,hx} ‚äÜ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Subcase 2. Dz¬Ø‚äòDy¬Ø‚äò¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùëß¬Øsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚äò over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG is not a, possibly open ended, real interval.

In what follows for an integer interval D:=[l..h]D:=[l..h]italic_D := [ italic_l . . italic_h ] we write D>0ùê∑0D>0italic_D > 0 if l>0ùëô0l>0italic_l > 0, D<0ùê∑0D<0italic_D < 0 if h<0‚Ñé0h<0italic_h < 0. Also recall that ‚ü®D‚ü©:={x‚ààùíµ‚à£l<x<h}assigndelimited-‚ü®‚ü©ùê∑conditional-setùë•ùíµùëôùë•‚Ñé\langle D\rangle:=\mbox{$\{{x\in{\cal Z}\mid l<x<h}\}$}‚ü® italic_D ‚ü© := { italic_x ‚àà caligraphic_Z ‚à£ italic_l < italic_x < italic_h }.

This subcase can arise only when Dz>0subscriptùê∑ùëß0D_{z}>0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 and 0‚àà‚ü®Dy‚ü©0delimited-‚ü®‚ü©subscriptùê∑ùë¶0\in\langle D_{y}\rangle0 ‚àà ‚ü® italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© or Dz<0subscriptùê∑ùëß0D_{z}<0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 and 0‚àà‚ü®Dy‚ü©0delimited-‚ü®‚ü©subscriptùê∑ùë¶0\in\langle D_{y}\rangle0 ‚àà ‚ü® italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü©, see [18] (reported as Theorem 4.8 in [15]), where the definition of the division of real intervals is considered.

Since œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is closed under the MULTIPLICATION rule 3

Dy‚äÜint‚Å°(Dz/Dx).subscriptùê∑ùë¶intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•D_{y}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x}).italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚äÜ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

So int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)‚â†‚àÖintsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})\neq\mbox{$\emptyset$}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â† ‚àÖ since by assumption Dysubscriptùê∑ùë¶D_{y}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is non-empty. Also, since 0‚àâDz0subscriptùê∑ùëß0\not\in D_{z}0 ‚àâ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)‚â†ùíµintsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•ùíµ\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})\neq{\cal Z}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â† caligraphic_Z. So int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is a non-empty integer interval such that 0‚àà‚ü®int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)‚ü©0delimited-‚ü®‚ü©intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•0\in\langle\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})\rangle0 ‚àà ‚ü® roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ü©.

But Dz>0subscriptùê∑ùëß0D_{z}>0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 or Dz<0subscriptùê∑ùëß0D_{z}<0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so if Dx>0subscriptùê∑ùë•0D_{x}>0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, then int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)>0intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})>0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) > 0 or int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)<0intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})<0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < 0 and if Dx<0subscriptùê∑ùë•0D_{x}<0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, then int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)>0intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})>0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) > 0 or int‚Å°(Dz/Dx)<0intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})<0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < 0, as well. So 0‚àà‚ü®Dx‚ü©0delimited-‚ü®‚ü©subscriptùê∑ùë•0\in\langle D_{x}\rangle0 ‚àà ‚ü® italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü©. Hence 0‚àà‚ü®Dx‚ü©‚à©‚ü®Dy‚ü©0delimited-‚ü®‚ü©subscriptùê∑ùë•delimited-‚ü®‚ü©subscriptùê∑ùë¶0\in\langle D_{x}\rangle\cap\langle D_{y}\rangle0 ‚àà ‚ü® italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© ‚à© ‚ü® italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© while 0‚àâDz0subscriptùê∑ùëß0\not\in D_{z}0 ‚àâ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This contradicts (5). So this subcase cannot arise.

The proof for the variable yùë¶yitalic_y is symmetric to the one for the variable xùë•xitalic_x.

Consider now the variable zùëßzitalic_z. œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 1 rule, so

Dz‚äÜint‚Å°(Dx‚ãÖDy).subscriptùê∑ùëßint‚ãÖsubscriptùê∑ùë•subscriptùê∑ùë¶D_{z}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{x}\cdot D_{y}).italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚äÜ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Take now c‚ààDzùëêsubscriptùê∑ùëßc\in D_{z}italic_c ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then there exist a1,a2‚ààDxsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëé2subscriptùê∑ùë•a_{1},a_{2}\in D_{x}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b1,b2‚ààDysubscriptùëè1subscriptùëè2subscriptùê∑ùë¶b_{1},b_{2}\in D_{y}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that a1‚ãÖb1‚â§c‚â§a2‚ãÖb2.‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè1ùëê‚ãÖsubscriptùëé2subscriptùëè2a_{1}\cdot b_{1}\leq c\leq a_{2}\cdot b_{2}.italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_c ‚â§ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . We can assume that both inequalities are strict, that is,

a1‚ãÖb1<c<a2‚ãÖb2,‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè1ùëê‚ãÖsubscriptùëé2subscriptùëè2a_{1}\cdot b_{1}<c<a_{2}\cdot b_{2},italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (10)

since otherwise the desired conclusion is established.

Let

a¬Ø:=min‚Å°(a1,a2),a¬Ø:=max‚Å°(a1,a2),b¬Ø:=min‚Å°(b1,b2),b¬Ø:=max‚Å°(b1,b2).formulae-sequenceassign¬Øùëéminsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëé2formulae-sequenceassign¬Øùëémaxsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëé2formulae-sequenceassign¬Øùëèminsubscriptùëè1subscriptùëè2assign¬Øùëèmaxsubscriptùëè1subscriptùëè2\underline{a}:=\operatorname{min}(a_{1},a_{2}),\overline{a}:=\operatorname{max}(a_{1},a_{2}),\underline{b}:=\operatorname{min}(b_{1},b_{2}),\overline{b}:=\operatorname{max}(b_{1},b_{2}).under¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , under¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , over¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

We now show that a‚àà[a¬Ø..a¬Ø]a\in[\underline{a}..\overline{a}]italic_a ‚àà [ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG . . over¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG ] and b‚àà[b¬Ø..b¬Ø]b\in[\underline{b}..\overline{b}]italic_b ‚àà [ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG . . over¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ] exist such that c=a‚ãÖbùëê‚ãÖùëéùëèc=a\cdot bitalic_c = italic_a ‚ãÖ italic_b. Since [a¬Ø..a¬Ø]‚äÜDx¬Ø[\underline{a}..\overline{a}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{x}}[ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG . . over¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG ] ‚äÜ over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG and [b¬Ø..b¬Ø]‚äÜDy¬Ø[\underline{b}..\overline{b}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{y}}[ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG . . over¬Ø start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ] ‚äÜ over¬Ø start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, this will establish the bounds consistency of zùëßzitalic_z.

The choice of aùëéaitalic_a and bùëèbitalic_b depends on the signs of a1subscriptùëé1a_{1}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b2subscriptùëè2b_{2}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. When one of these values is zero, the choice is provided in the following table, where in each case on the account of (10) no division by zero takes place:

condition aùëéaitalic_a bùëèbitalic_b
a1=0subscriptùëé10a_{1}=0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 c/b2ùëêsubscriptùëè2c/b_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT b2subscriptùëè2b_{2}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
a2=0subscriptùëé20a_{2}=0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 c/b1ùëêsubscriptùëè1c/b_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT b1subscriptùëè1b_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
b1=0subscriptùëè10b_{1}=0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 a2subscriptùëé2a_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT c/a2ùëêsubscriptùëé2c/a_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
b2=0subscriptùëè20b_{2}=0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 a1subscriptùëé1a_{1}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT c/a1ùëêsubscriptùëé1c/a_{1}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

It is straightforward to show that in each case the quotient belongs to the corresponding interval. For example, when a1=0subscriptùëé10a_{1}=0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 we need to prove that c/b2‚àà[a¬Ø..a¬Ø]c/b_{2}\in[\underline{a}..\overline{a}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ under¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG . . over¬Ø start_ARG italic_a end_ARG ]. By (10) a2‚â†0subscriptùëé20a_{2}\neq 0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â† 0. If a2>0subscriptùëé20a_{2}>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, then again by (10), b2>0subscriptùëè20b_{2}>0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, so c/b2‚àà[0..a2]c/b_{2}\in[0..a_{2}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ 0 . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. In turn, if a2<0subscriptùëé20a_{2}<0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, then also by (10) b2<0subscriptùëè20b_{2}<0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so, yet again by (10), c/b2‚àà[a2‚Å¢..0]ùëêsubscriptùëè2delimited-[]subscriptùëé2..0c/b_{2}\in[a_{2}..0]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ..0 ].

When neither a1subscriptùëé1a_{1}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT nor b2subscriptùëè2b_{2}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is zero, the choice of aùëéaitalic_a and bùëèbitalic_b has to be argued case by case.

Case 1. a1>0,b2>0formulae-sequencesubscriptùëé10subscriptùëè20a_{1}>0,\ b_{2}>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0.

Then by (10) b1<c/a1subscriptùëè1ùëêsubscriptùëé1b_{1}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a2ùëêsubscriptùëè2subscriptùëé2c/b_{2}<a_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both b2<c/a1subscriptùëè2ùëêsubscriptùëé1b_{2}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a1ùëêsubscriptùëè2subscriptùëé1c/b_{2}<a_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1‚ãÖb2<c<a1‚ãÖb2‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2ùëê‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either c/a1‚â§b2ùëêsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2c/a_{1}\leq b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or a1‚â§c/b2subscriptùëé1ùëêsubscriptùëè2a_{1}\leq c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1‚àà[b1..b2]c/a_{1}\in[b_{1}..b_{2}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2‚àà[a1..a2]c/b_{2}\in[a_{1}..a_{2}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Case 2. a1>0,b2<0formulae-sequencesubscriptùëé10subscriptùëè20a_{1}>0,\ b_{2}<0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0.

Then by (10) b1<c/a1subscriptùëè1ùëêsubscriptùëé1b_{1}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a2<c/b2subscriptùëé2ùëêsubscriptùëè2a_{2}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both b2<c/a1subscriptùëè2ùëêsubscriptùëé1b_{2}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a1<c/b2subscriptùëé1ùëêsubscriptùëè2a_{1}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1‚ãÖb2<c<a1‚ãÖb2‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2ùëê‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either c/a1‚â§b2ùëêsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2c/a_{1}\leq b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or c/b2‚â§a2ùëêsubscriptùëè2subscriptùëé2c/b_{2}\leq a_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1‚àà[b1..b2]c/a_{1}\in[b_{1}..b_{2}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2‚àà[a2..a1]c/b_{2}\in[a_{2}..a_{1}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Case 3. a1<0,b2>0formulae-sequencesubscriptùëé10subscriptùëè20a_{1}<0,\ b_{2}>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0.

Then by (10) c/a1<b1ùëêsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè1c/a_{1}<b_{1}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a2ùëêsubscriptùëè2subscriptùëé2c/b_{2}<a_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both c/a1<b2ùëêsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2c/a_{1}<b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a1ùëêsubscriptùëè2subscriptùëé1c/b_{2}<a_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1‚ãÖb2<c<a1‚ãÖb2‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2ùëê‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either b2‚â§c/a1subscriptùëè2ùëêsubscriptùëé1b_{2}\leq c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or a1‚â§c/b2subscriptùëé1ùëêsubscriptùëè2a_{1}\leq c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1‚àà[b2..b1]c/a_{1}\in[b_{2}..b_{1}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2‚àà[a1..a2]c/b_{2}\in[a_{1}..a_{2}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Case 4. a1<0,b2<0formulae-sequencesubscriptùëé10subscriptùëè20a_{1}<0,\ b_{2}<0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0.

Then by (10) c/a1<b1ùëêsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè1c/a_{1}<b_{1}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a2<c/b2subscriptùëé2ùëêsubscriptùëè2a_{2}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both c/a1<b2ùëêsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2c/a_{1}<b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a1<c/b2subscriptùëé1ùëêsubscriptùëè2a_{1}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1‚ãÖb2<c<a1‚ãÖb2‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2ùëê‚ãÖsubscriptùëé1subscriptùëè2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either b2‚â§c/a1subscriptùëè2ùëêsubscriptùëé1b_{2}\leq c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or c/b2‚â§a1ùëêsubscriptùëè2subscriptùëé1c/b_{2}\leq a_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1‚àà[b2..b1]c/a_{1}\in[b_{2}..b_{1}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2‚àà[a2..a1]c/b_{2}\in[a_{2}..a_{1}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

So in each of the four cases we can choose either a:=a1assignùëésubscriptùëé1a:=a_{1}italic_a := italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b:=c/a1assignùëèùëêsubscriptùëé1b:=c/a_{1}italic_b := italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or a:=c/b2assignùëéùëêsubscriptùëè2a:=c/b_{2}italic_a := italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b:=b2assignùëèsubscriptùëè2b:=b_{2}italic_b := italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. ‚ñ°‚ñ°\Box‚ñ°

Proof of the MULTIPLICATION Theorem 10.1.

The weak interval division produces larger sets than the interval division. As a result the MULTIPLICATION rules 2w and 3w yield a weaker reduction than the original MULTIPLICATION rules 2 and 3. So it suffices to prove that œï:=‚ü®x‚ãÖy=z;x‚ààDx,y‚ààDy,z‚ààDz‚ü©assignitalic-œïdelimited-‚ü®‚ü©formulae-sequence‚ãÖùë•ùë¶ùëßformulae-sequenceùë•subscriptùê∑ùë•formulae-sequenceùë¶subscriptùê∑ùë¶ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùëß\phi:=\langle x\cdot y=z\ ;\ x\in D_{x},y\in D_{y},z\in D_{z}\rangleitalic_œï := ‚ü® italic_x ‚ãÖ italic_y = italic_z ; italic_x ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z ‚àà italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 1, 2 and 3 rules assuming that it is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 1, 2w and 3w rules. Suppose that Dx=[lx..hx],Dy=[ly..hy],Dz=[lz..hz]D_{x}=[l_{x}..h_{x}],D_{y}=[l_{y}..h_{y}],D_{z}=[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] , italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] , italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. The assumption implies

{lx,hx}‚äÜint‚Å°(Dz:Dy)subscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•int:subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\{l_{x},h_{x}\}\subseteq\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{y}){ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ‚äÜ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (11)

and

{ly,hy}‚äÜint‚Å°(Dz:Dx)subscriptùëôùë¶subscript‚Ñéùë¶int:subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë•\{l_{y},h_{y}\}\subseteq\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{x}){ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ‚äÜ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (12)

The proof is by contradiction. Assume that (11) and (12) hold, while œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is not closed under application of MULTIPLICATION 2 and 3. Without loss of generality, suppose that MULTIPLICATION 2 is the rule that can make a further reduction. This is the case iff

int‚Å°(Dz/Dy)‚äÇint‚Å°(Dz:Dy).intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶int:subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})\subset\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{y}).roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚äÇ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

By definition, the proper inclusion implies that ly‚â•0subscriptùëôùë¶0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0 or hy‚â§0subscript‚Ñéùë¶0h_{y}\leq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ 0. Assume ly‚â•0subscriptùëôùë¶0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0, the case for hy‚â§0subscript‚Ñéùë¶0h_{y}\leq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ 0 is similar. Let ly‚Ä≤:=max‚Å°(1,ly)assignsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤max1subscriptùëôùë¶l_{y}^{\prime}:=\operatorname{max}(1,l_{y})italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := roman_max ( 1 , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), and let A:={lz/ly‚Ä≤,lz/hy,hz/ly‚Ä≤,hz/hy}assignùê¥subscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùë¶subscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùëßsubscript‚Ñéùë¶A:=\{l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime},l_{z}/h_{y},h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime},h_{z}/h_{y}\}italic_A := { italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, and B:={lz/lx,lz/hx,hz/lx,hz/hx}assignùêµsubscriptùëôùëßsubscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùëßsubscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùëßsubscript‚Ñéùë•B:=\{l_{z}/l_{x},l_{z}/h_{x},h_{z}/l_{x},h_{z}/h_{x}\}italic_B := { italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. A further implication of the proper inclusion is that one or both of ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hysubscript‚Ñéùë¶h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT do not have a multiple in Dzsubscriptùê∑ùëßD_{z}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: otherwise min‚Å°(A)minùê¥\operatorname{min}(A)roman_min ( italic_A ) and max‚Å°(A)maxùê¥\operatorname{max}(A)roman_max ( italic_A ) would be elements of Dz/Dysubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶D_{z}/D_{y}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and we would have int‚Å°(Dz:Dy)=int‚Å°(Dz/Dy)int:subscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶intsubscriptùê∑ùëßsubscriptùê∑ùë¶\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{y})=\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). The cases for ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hysubscript‚Ñéùë¶h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can be seen in isolation, and their proofs are similar, so here we only consider the case that ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT does not have a multiple in Dzsubscriptùê∑ùëßD_{z}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. In what follows we can assume 0‚àâDz0subscriptùê∑ùëß0\notin D_{z}0 ‚àâ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, since otherwise ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hysubscript‚Ñéùë¶h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT do have a multiple in Dzsubscriptùê∑ùëßD_{z}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.


Case 1. lz>0subscriptùëôùëß0l_{z}>0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0.
From (11) it follows that hx‚â§‚åämax‚Å°(A)‚åãsubscript‚Ñéùë•maxùê¥h_{x}\leq\lfloor\operatorname{max}(A)\rflooritalic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚åä roman_max ( italic_A ) ‚åã, which for the case ly‚Ä≤,hy,lz,hz>0superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùë¶subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëß0l_{y}^{\prime},h_{y},l_{z},h_{z}>0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 that we consider here implies hx‚â§‚åähz/ly‚Ä≤‚åãsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤h_{x}\leq\lfloor h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rflooritalic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚åä italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åã. Because [lz..hz][l_{z}..h_{z}][ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] does not contain a multiple of ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have ‚åähz/ly‚Ä≤‚åã=‚åälz/ly‚Ä≤‚åãsubscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤\lfloor h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rfloor=\lfloor l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rfloor‚åä italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åã = ‚åä italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åã, so

hx‚â§‚åälz/ly‚Ä≤‚åã.subscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤h_{x}\leq\lfloor l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rfloor.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚åä italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åã .

A further consequence of (11) is that lx,hx>0subscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•0l_{x},h_{x}>0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0. From (12) it follows that ly‚Ä≤‚â•‚åàmin‚Å°(B)‚åâsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤minùêµl_{y}^{\prime}\geq\lceil\operatorname{min}(B)\rceilitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â• ‚åà roman_min ( italic_B ) ‚åâ, which for lx,lz>0subscriptùëôùë•subscriptùëôùëß0l_{x},l_{z}>0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 implies

ly‚Ä≤‚â•‚åàlz/hx‚åâ‚â•lz/hx‚â•lz/‚åähz/ly‚Ä≤‚åã.superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùë•subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}\geq\lceil l_{z}/h_{x}\rceil\geq l_{z}/h_{x}\geq l_{z}/\lfloor h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rfloor.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â• ‚åà italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚åâ ‚â• italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ‚åä italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åã .

Because ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is no divisor of lzsubscriptùëôùëßl_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and both numbers are positive, we have ‚åälz/ly‚Ä≤‚åã<lz/ly‚Ä≤subscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤\lfloor l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rfloor<l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}‚åä italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åã < italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and consequently ly‚Ä≤>lz/(lz/ly‚Ä≤)superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscriptùëôùëßsubscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}>l_{z}/(l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime})italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ( italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), leading to ly‚Ä≤>ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}>l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is a contradiction.


Case 2. hz<0subscript‚Ñéùëß0h_{z}<0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0.
Similarly, because ly‚Ä≤,hy>0superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùë¶0l_{y}^{\prime},h_{y}>0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 and lz,hz<0subscriptùëôùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëß0l_{z},h_{z}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, it follows from (11) that lx‚â•‚åàmin‚Å°(A)‚åâ=‚åàlz/ly‚Ä≤‚åâsubscriptùëôùë•minùê¥subscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{x}\geq\lceil\operatorname{min}(A)\rceil=\lceil l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceilitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• ‚åà roman_min ( italic_A ) ‚åâ = ‚åà italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åâ, and lx,hx<0subscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùë•0l_{x},h_{x}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0. Because [lz..lh][l_{z}..l_{h}][ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] does not contain a multiple of ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have ‚åàlz/ly‚Ä≤‚åâ=‚åàhz/ly‚Ä≤‚åâsubscriptùëôùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤\lceil l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceil=\lceil h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceil‚åà italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åâ = ‚åà italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åâ, so

lx‚â•‚åàhz/ly‚Ä≤‚åâ.subscriptùëôùë•subscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{x}\geq\lceil h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceil.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• ‚åà italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åâ .

We use this information in the following implication of (12):

ly‚Ä≤‚â•‚åàmin‚Å°(B)‚åâ=‚åàhz/lx‚Ä≤‚åâ‚â•hz/lx‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤minùêµsubscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë•‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë•‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}\geq\lceil\operatorname{min}(B)\rceil=\lceil h_{z}/l_{x}^{\prime}\rceil\geq h_{z}/l_{x}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â• ‚åà roman_min ( italic_B ) ‚åâ = ‚åà italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åâ ‚â• italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

to get ly‚Ä≤‚â•hz/‚åàhz/ly‚Ä≤‚åâsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}\geq h_{z}/\lceil h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceilitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚â• italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ‚åà italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åâ. Because |‚åàhz/ly‚Ä≤‚åâ|<|hz/ly‚Ä≤|subscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤|\lceil h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceil|<|h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}|| ‚åà italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚åâ | < | italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT |, we have ly‚Ä≤>hz/(hz/ly‚Ä≤)superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤subscript‚Ñéùëßsubscript‚Ñéùëßsuperscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}>h_{z}/(h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime})italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), leading to ly‚Ä≤>ly‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùëôùë¶‚Ä≤l_{y}^{\prime}>l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. ‚ñ°‚ñ°\Box‚ñ°
